org.opends.guitools.controlpanel.browser

Class BrowserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.guitools.controlpanel.browser.BrowserController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, TreeExpansionListener, ReferralAuthenticationListener

    public class BrowserController
extends Object
implements TreeExpansionListener, ReferralAuthenticationListener
    This is the main class of the LDAP entry browser. It is in charge of updating a tree that is passed as parameter. Every instance of BrowserController is associated with a unique JTree. The different visualization options are passed to BrowserController using some setter and getter methods (the user can specify for instance whether the entries must be sorted or not).

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrowserController

        public BrowserController(JTree tree,
                         LDAPConnectionPool cpool,
                         IconPool ipool)
        Constructor of the BrowserController.
        Parameters:
        tree - the tree that must be updated.
        cpool - the connection pool object that will provide the connections to be used.
        ipool - the icon pool to be used to retrieve the icons that will be used to render the nodes in the tree.

    • Method Detail

      • setConnections

        public void setConnections(ServerDescriptor server,
                           ConnectionWrapper connConfiguration,
                           ConnectionWrapper connUserData)
        Set the connection for accessing the directory. Since we must use different controls when searching the configuration and the user data, two connections must be provided (this is done to avoid synchronization issues). We also pass the server descriptor corresponding to the connections to have a proper rendering of the root node.
        Parameters:
        server - the server descriptor.
        connConfiguration - the connection to be used to retrieve the data in the configuration base DNs.
        connUserData - the connection to be used to retrieve the data in the user base DNs.

        Return the connection for accessing the directory configuration.
        Returns:
        the connection for accessing the directory configuration.

      • getConnectionPool

        public LDAPConnectionPool getConnectionPool()
        Return the connection pool used by this controller. If a client class adds authentication to the connection pool, it must inform the controller by calling notifyAuthDataChanged().
        Returns:
        the connection pool used by this controller.

        Returns:

      • hasSuffix

        public boolean hasSuffix(DN suffixDn)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Tells whether the given suffix is in the tree or not.
        Parameters:
        suffixDn - the DN of the suffix to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        true if the provided String is the DN of a suffix and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a node with the given dn exists but is not a suffix node.

      • addSuffix

        public TreePath addSuffix(DN suffixDn,
                          DN parentSuffixDn)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Add an LDAP suffix to this controller. A new node is added in the JTree and a refresh is started.
        Parameters:
        suffixDn - the DN of the suffix.
        parentSuffixDn - the DN of the parent suffix (or null if there is no parent DN).
        Returns:
        the TreePath of the new node.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a node with the given dn exists.

      • addNodeUnderRoot

        public TreePath addNodeUnderRoot(DN nodeDn)
        Add an LDAP suffix to this controller. A new node is added in the JTree and a refresh is started.
        Parameters:
        nodeDn - the DN of the node to be added.
        Returns:
        the TreePath of the new node.

      • removeAllUnderRoot

        public TreePath removeAllUnderRoot()
        Remove all the suffixes. The controller removes all the nodes from the JTree except the root.
        Returns:
        the TreePath of the root node.

        Return the display flags.

        Set the display flags and call startRefresh().

      • setDisplayAttribute

        public void setDisplayAttribute(String displayAttribute)
        Set the display attribute (the attribute that will be used to retrieve the string that will appear in the tree when rendering the node). This routine collapses the JTree and invokes startRefresh().
        Parameters:
        displayAttribute - the display attribute to be used.

      • getDisplayAttribute

        public String getDisplayAttribute()
        Returns the attribute used to display the entry. RDN_ATTRIBUTE is the rdn is used.
        Returns:
        the attribute used to display the entry.

        Returns:
        true if we are showing the attribute name and false otherwise.

        Sets the maximum number of children to display for a node. 0 if there is no limit
        Parameters:
        maxChildren - the maximum number of children to display for a node.

      • getMaxChildren

        public int getMaxChildren()
        Return the maximum number of children to display.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of children to display.

      • isFollowReferrals

        public boolean isFollowReferrals()
        Return true if this controller follows referrals.
        Returns:
        true if this controller follows referrals, false otherwise.

      • setFollowReferrals

        public void setFollowReferrals(boolean followReferrals)
        Enable/display the following of referrals. This routine starts a refresh on each referral node.
        Parameters:
        followReferrals - whether to follow referrals or not.

      • isSorted

        public boolean isSorted()
        Return true if entries are displayed sorted.
        Returns:
        true if entries are displayed sorted, false otherwise.

      • setSorted

        public void setSorted(boolean sorted)
        Enable/disable entry sort. This routine collapses the JTree and invokes startRefresh().
        Parameters:
        sorted - whether to sort the entries or not.

      • isShowContainerOnly

        public boolean isShowContainerOnly()
        Return true if only container entries are displayed. An entry is a container if: - it has some children - or its class is one of the container classes specified with setContainerClasses().
        Returns:
        true if only container entries are displayed and false otherwise.

      • setShowContainerOnly

        public void setShowContainerOnly(boolean showContainerOnly)
        Enable or disable container display and call startRefresh().
        Parameters:
        showContainerOnly - whether to display only containers or all the entries.

      • getNodeInfoFromPath

        public BrowserNodeInfo getNodeInfoFromPath(TreePath path)
        Find the BrowserNodeInfo associated to a TreePath and returns the describing IBrowserNodeInfo.
        Parameters:
        path - the TreePath associated with the node we are searching.
        Returns:
        the BrowserNodeInfo associated to the TreePath.

      • getContainerClasses

        public String[] getContainerClasses()
        Return the array of container classes for this controller. Warning: the returned array is not cloned.
        Returns:
        the array of container classes for this controller.

      • setContainerClasses

        public void setContainerClasses(String[] containerClasses)
        Set the list of container classes and calls startRefresh(). Warning: the array is not cloned.
        Parameters:
        containerClasses - the lis of container classes.

      • getNumSubordinateHacker

        public NumSubordinateHacker getNumSubordinateHacker()
        NUMSUBORDINATE HACK Make the hacker public so that RefreshTask can use it.
        Returns:
        the NumSubordinateHacker object used by the controller.

      • setNumSubordinateHacker

        public void setNumSubordinateHacker(NumSubordinateHacker h)
        NUMSUBORDINATE HACK Set the hacker. Note this method does not trigger any refresh. The caller is supposed to do it afterward.
        Parameters:
        h - the NumSubordinateHacker.

      • addBrowserEventListener

        public void addBrowserEventListener(BrowserEventListener l)
        Add a BrowserEventListener to this controller.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to be added.

      • notifyEntryAdded

        public TreePath notifyEntryAdded(BrowserNodeInfo parentInfo,
                                 DN newEntryDn)
        Notify this controller that an entry has been added. The controller adds a new node in the JTree and starts refreshing this new node. This routine returns the tree path about the new entry.
        Parameters:
        parentInfo - the parent node of the entry added.
        newEntryDn - the dn of the entry to be added.
        Returns:
        the tree path associated with the new entry.

      • notifyEntryDeleted

        public TreePath notifyEntryDeleted(BrowserNodeInfo nodeInfo)
        Notify this controller that a entry has been deleted. The controller removes the corresponding node from the JTree and returns the TreePath of the parent node.
        Parameters:
        nodeInfo - the node to be deleted.
        Returns:
        the tree path associated with the parent of the deleted node.

      • notifyEntryChanged

        public void notifyEntryChanged(BrowserNodeInfo nodeInfo)
        Notify this controller that an entry has changed. The controller starts refreshing the corresponding node. Child nodes are not refreshed.
        Parameters:
        nodeInfo - the node that changed.

      • notifyAuthDataChanged

        public void notifyAuthDataChanged()
        Notify this controller that authentication data have changed in the connection pool.
        Specified by:
        notifyAuthDataChanged in interface ReferralAuthenticationListener

      • startRefresh

        public void startRefresh(BrowserNodeInfo nodeInfo)
        Start a refresh from the specified node. If some refresh are on-going on descendant nodes, they are stopped. If nodeInfo is null, refresh is started from the root.
        Parameters:
        nodeInfo - the node to be refreshed.

      • treeExpanded

        public void treeExpanded(TreeExpansionEvent event)
        For BrowserController private use. When a node is expanded, refresh it if it needs it (to search the children for instance).
        Specified by:
        treeExpanded in interface TreeExpansionListener
        Parameters:
        event - the tree expansion event.

      • treeCollapsed

        public void treeCollapsed(TreeExpansionEvent event)
        For BrowserController private use. When a node is collapsed the refresh tasks on it are canceled.
        Specified by:
        treeCollapsed in interface TreeExpansionListener
        Parameters:
        event - the tree collapse event.

      • setInspectedNode

        public void setInspectedNode(BrowserNodeInfo node)
        Sets which is the inspected node. This method simply marks the selected node in the tree so that it can have a different rendering. This is useful for instance when the right panel has a list of entries to which the menu action apply, to make a difference between the selected node in the tree (to which the action in the main menu will not apply) and the selected nodes in the right pane.
        Parameters:
        node - the selected node.

      • getTreeModel

        public DefaultTreeModel getTreeModel()
        The tree model created by the controller and assigned to the JTree.
        Returns:
        the tree model.

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(Filter filter)
        Sets the filter that must be used by the browser controller to retrieve entries.
        Parameters:
        filter - the LDAP filter.

      • getFilter

        public Filter getFilter()
        Returns the filter that is being used to search the entries.
        Returns:
        the filter that is being used to search the entries.

      • isConfigurationNode

        public boolean isConfigurationNode(BasicNode node)
        Returns whether a given node is a configuration node or not.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to analyze.
        Returns:
        true if the node is a configuration node, false otherwise.

      • findConnectionForDisplayedEntry

        public ConnectionWithControls findConnectionForDisplayedEntry(BasicNode node)
                                                       throws LdapException
        Return the LDAP connection to search the displayed entry (which can be the local or remote entry).
        Parameters:
        node - the node for which we want toe LDAP connection.
        Returns:
        the LDAP connection to search the displayed entry.
        Throws:
        LdapException - if there is an error retrieving the connection.

      • findChildNode

        public static int findChildNode(BasicNode parent,
                                DN childDn)
        Find a child node matching a given DN. result >= 0 result is the index of the node matching childDn. result < 0 -(result + 1) is the index at which the new node must be inserted.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent node of the node that is being searched.
        childDn - the DN of the entry that is being searched.
        Returns:
        the index of the node matching childDn.

      • getQueueSize

        public int getQueueSize()
        Returns the size of the queue containing the different tasks. It can be used to know if there are search operations ongoing.
        Returns:
        the number of RefreshTask operations ongoing (or waiting to start).

      • getHasSubOrdinates

        public static boolean getHasSubOrdinates(Entry entry)
        Returns whether the entry has subordinates or not. It uses an algorithm based in hasSubordinates and numSubordinates attributes.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to analyze.
        Returns:
        true if the entry has subordinates according to the values of hasSubordinates and numSubordinates, returns false if none of the attributes could be found.

      • getReferral

        public static String[] getReferral(SearchResultEntry entry)
        Returns the value of the 'ref' attribute. null if the attribute is not present.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to analyze.
        Returns:
        the value of the ref attribute. null if the attribute could not be found.

      • nodeIsExpanded

        public boolean nodeIsExpanded(BasicNode node)
        Returns true if the node is expanded.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to analyze.
        Returns:
        true if the node is expanded and false otherwise.

      • expandNode

        public void expandNode(BasicNode node)
        Expands node. Must be run from the event thread. This is called when the node is automatically expanded.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to expand.

      • isAutomaticExpand

        public boolean isAutomaticExpand()
        Returns whether we are in automatic expand mode. This mode is used when the user specifies a filter and all the nodes are automatically expanded.
        Returns:
        true if we are in automatic expand mode and false otherwise.

      • setAutomaticExpand

        public void setAutomaticExpand(boolean automaticExpand)
        Sets the automatic expand mode.
        Parameters:
        automaticExpand - whether to expand automatically the nodes or not.
